content.description:
The only way to get to this section is by first climbing David's Climb (10d) or Skinflint (5.9)  

  A twelve foot dihedral protected only by a single bolt. Finger pockets. Finish by pulling yourself up and over onto a moderate slab. Best done if you complete this as part of your second pitch. 

  Descend down Sharks Fin Gully.

This is kind of an odd route/section. It's stuck between the middle of two other climbs: Looks Good (5.7) and Tricky Groove (5.10a). I'm not aware of any ways to avoid starting on Looks Good and finishing with Tricky Groove.
content.location: Just to the left of Davids Climb. Start with steep slab on Looks Good.

content.description: Essentially a protectable face climb with 3 drilled pins on the upper section.  Begin up the obvious thin crack to the right of Mecca.  Thin protection in the crack leads to great face climbing up the dark, steep terrain above.  Highly recommended and a full value climb.
content.protection: Nuts and TCU's for lower section, quickdraws for up higher.  Nuts and TCU's for anchor.
content.location: Begin to the right of Mecca.  Descend Shark Fin Gully or downclimb Heart Route (5.6) if you are so inclined.

content.description:
Scramble up to the ledge (or belay from below) to the obvious splitter crack (one of the Butte's few).  Funky moves lead up to a couple thin hand jams which is the crux about 10 feet up.  This is quickly followed by a perfect hand crack that slowly widens as the climb progresses.  Certainly one of the best climbs at the Butte. 

  Single set of cams to 4 inches.  Nuts and TCU's for anchor.
content.protection: Full set of cams from TCU's to 4 inches.  Nuts useful down low and for the anchor.
content.location: Descend via Shark Fin Gully or downclimb Heart Route (5.6) if you are so inclined.

content.description: Starts off with a lichen covered steep slab then finished with an OW crack that starts about 4 feet off the ground. A good start to Skinflint (5.9).
content.protection: Standard rack. #4 Cam with protect the OW.

content.description: Mixed crack and face climbing up a stem box and then up a general crack weakness to the belay ledge.  So named because of a heart shaped graffiti tag from a long-ago love-struck artist.  Takes a variety of protection. Nuts and TCU's for anchor.
content.protection: Full rack.  Plenty of opportunities for a variety of protection.

content.description: Start up the obvious dihedral around to the right from Koran.  Excellent cracks up vertical rock to a cruxy "hump" that protects well and has stymied many a would-be ascensionist.  Pull the crux to a small ledge and then finish in a flaring dihedral with (if I remember correctly) a fixed pin.  Belay from the ledge on top of Mecca, but beware rope drag.
content.protection: Thin TCU's to hand sized.  Nuts and TCU's for the anchor.

climbs.name: Be Here Now
climbs.fa: FA: TR: Rusty Baillie and Charlie Lyon, 1989  rigged up by Rusty Baillie and Bob Chalfont   First clean lead by Matt Perlman, 1991

content.description: Short but super fun. Climb up the obvious line of pitons and bolts toward the anchor.
content.protection: There's two questionable pitons and two bomber bolts on this route - typical. Some small cams/micro nuts could help to protect the bottom, also a #2 c4 will get you between the bolts.
content.location: At the "GHS" petroglyph area up high on the east ridge. If that doesn't ring any bells, follow the ridge up from the south side, not climbing any harder than 5.1 until you're standing on a ramp that says GHS, amongst other things. Make your way down into the gully to the north by scrambling down to a notch in the boulders. This way is a bit sketch and requires some ninja skill, but totally doable. If you're not into it, scramble back down the ridge until you can make your way above the wall behind the route, keep going until you reach the chimney which can be down climbed into the gully.

content.description:
The narrow buttress end of Thumb Butte with some of the best climbs that the Butte has to offer.  Typically shady. 

  Routes from left to right are: Heart Route, Mecca, Quran, Davidâ€™s Climb and Skin Flint.
